Punnabhadda：The Mahā Niddesa （pp．89，92），in its explanation of vattasuddhikā，mentions，among others，Punnabhaddavattika，Vāsudevavattika，Baladevavattika and Manibhaddavattika．Punnabhadda is，therefore，probably the name of a Yakkha like Vāsudeva and Baladeva．

The N．P．D．，s．v．Punna，suggests Punnabhadda，was the father of the Yakkha Harikesa．The Mahābhārata （i．35，1557） gives Pūrnabhadra as the name of a serpent．
